授業目的:
This course introduces students to aspects of Japanese religion by studying selected religious sites in the
Kansai area. Students are required to apply the course readings to their fieldwork with the aim to developing critical insights into the characteristics of Japanese religion and the theories of the study of religion in general. All fieldtrips are compulsory.
到達目標: After taking this course, students will gain an understanding of the more salient aspects of Japanese religion as well as an appreciation of some of the central theoretical issues of religious studies.
授業方法: Face to face format. Mini lecture, presentation, class discussion, essay writing, fieldwork.
